modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to see and love despite human inability to save themselves from their own 'images'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From Niet-S1 (Image) to S2 (The Reality of the Cross) to S1 (The Love of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God entering S2 (the place of the 'really bad people') to establish S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the cross is described as 'grotesque' and 'ugly'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who 'sees', 'loves', and 'enters' the human condition. Human action is relegated to confession (passive-active response).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: come alongside others in their pain... for Christ's sake

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He sees a person that he loves more than life

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul, Jeremiah, Isaiah) are used as witnesses or truth-tellers rather than moral examples to imitate.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'unmasking'; moving from shame to being loved.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace through faith, where the 'faith' is being drawn by the Spirit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'bad news' of human image-obsession to the 'good news' of divine love is seamless.
spanning_punten: The call to 'come alongside others' at the end briefly shifts to an ethical program that could be read as a 'must', but it is grounded in the Spirit's drawing.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: entered the world to be executed alongside criminals in the same manner as they

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (being able) to be present at the Cross.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen as a 'delusion' and 'fraudulence' that masks total poverty.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a divine gaze that is both judgmental (piercing masks) and redemptive (loving).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on God's 'Pouvoir' and 'Vouloir' (His love).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'coming alongside others' is clearly an overflow of being loved, not a new 'Devoir'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a grace-oriented sermon that uses the 'heavy opponent' of human hypocrisy to magnify the 'Subject-action' of God's love.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'image' metaphors, semiotics reveals that God remains the only actant capable of 'seeing' and 'acting'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the Corinthian context; semiotics shows how the 'Corinthian' role is mapped onto the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'Good' in Good Friday is not a human quality but a divine performance (Subject = God) against a cosmic opponent (Sin/Death).

volledige_subject_lijst: The Son of God gave up
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism.
